alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Gadsden; Jackson; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 7:01AM EDT until July 14 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT/1015 AM EDT/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Florida and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in Florida, Calhoun, Gadsden, Jackson and Liberty. In southwest Georgia, Decatur. * WHEN...Until 915 AM CDT /1015 AM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 601 AM CDT /701 AM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Blountstown, Quincy, Greensboro, Chattahoochee, Gretna, Bristol, Rock Bluff, Roy, Sycamore, Juniper, Torreya State Park, Lowry, Rosedale, Hosford, Hardin Heights, Selman, River Junction, Hardaway, Nettle Ridge and Macedonia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
